title: Hubmap sample block template schema
description: Hubmap sample block template schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.19

propertyDescriptions.sample_id: The HuBMAP ID for the sample assigned by the ingest portal. An example value might be "HBM743.CKJW.876"
propertyDescriptions.source_storage_time_value: How long was the source material (parent) stored, prior to this sample being processed. For tissue blocks, this would typically be the time between when the organ arrived in the lab and the processing of the organ began. In most cases this will likely be 0, while in some cases the organ might be stored (on ice) in the lab before dissection.
propertyDescriptions.volume_value: The volume of the sample block
propertyDescriptions.pathology_distance_value: If a surgical sample, how far from the pathology was the sample obtained.
propertyDescriptions.preparation_medium: The medium used during the sample preparation
propertyDescriptions.preparation_condition: The condition by which the preparation occurred, such as was the sample placed in dry ice during the preparation.
propertyDescriptions.processing_time_value: How long the tissue was being handled before the initial preservation. For tissue blocks, this would typically be the length of time from when the organ was received in the lab to when the tissue block is frozen or otherwise preserved (e.g., embedded in OCT).
propertyDescriptions.storage_medium: What was the sample preserved in.
propertyDescriptions.storage_method: The method by which the sample was stored, after preparation and before the assay was performed.
propertyDescriptions.quality_criteria: For example, RIN: 8.7. For suspensions, measured by visual inspection prior to cell lysis or defined by known parameters such as wells with several cells or no cells. This can be captured at a high level. "OK" or "not OK", or with more specificity such as "debris", "clump", "low clump".
propertyDescriptions.histological_report: histopathological reporting of key variables that are important for the tissue (absence of necrosis, comment on composition, significant pathology description, high level inflammation/fibrosis assessment, etc.)
propertyDescriptions.notes: Miscellaneous details about the sample, not captured in the existing metadata fields.
